title: ICC Men‚Äôs ODI World Cup final, IND vs AUS, as it happened: Pat Cummins and Co win record sixth title
content:
That‚Äôs all from Scroll‚Äôs coverage of the ICC Men‚Äôs ODI World Cup final. Good night!India would have hoped to do one better than they did in 2003 when they faced Australia in the ICC World Cup final in Johannesburg. But it wasn‚Äôt to be as the men in gold spoiled the party in Ahmedabad as they romped home to a six-wicket win and clinched a record sixth title win to become the 2023 ICC Men‚Äôs ODI World Cup champions. The run chase was always going to be tricky and despite India‚Äôs best efforts with half-centuries from Virat Kohli and KL Rahul, the Australian bowlers led by Mitchell Starc and captain Pat Cummins were incredible in restricting the dynamic Indian batting line-up to 240 all out. Despite a quick-fire start that saw Australia fall to 47/3, the Indian bowlers were then overpowered by the grit and determination of Travis Head and Marnus Labuschagne. Head took charge of the innings with his calm hitting and sensible strike rotation and Labuschagne was an able partner in the 192-run partnership that ultimately proved match-winning. After the horror start to Australia‚Äôs campaign that saw them beaten soundly by both India and South Africa, they redeemed themselves, beating both teams in the semi-finals and finals to remind the cricketing world of their title-winning experience and spirit. 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    #CWC23Final #INDvAUSThe Australians know the drill!For a record sixth time, Australia are the ICC Men's ODI World Cup CHAMPIONS!üì∏ Disney+Hotstarhttps://t.co/N2ErlyQjQs pic.twitter.com/mNSwwNvplS‚Äî The Field (@thefield_in) November 19, 2023



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Travis Head wins the Player of the Match award for his scintillating century in the World Cup final. Virat Kohli wins the Player of the Tournament award ‚Äì 765 runs in 11 matches, including three centuries and six half-centuries.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    #CWC23Final #INDvAUS"Just know how to get the job done""Easy win"Reactions as Australia win a record extending sixth ICC Men's ODI World Cup title in Ahmedabad. https://t.co/DughKLNVO9‚Äî The Field (@thefield_in) November 19, 2023



    Australia are now the holders of the Men's World Test Championship, the Men's and Women's ODI World Cup, and the Women's T20 World Cup (and Women's Commonwealth gold).‚Äî hypocaust (@_hypocaust) November 19, 2023



    CHAMPIONS! üèÜSo proud of our INCREDIBLE team! üá¶üá∫#CWC23 pic.twitter.com/7vq5SpTrwF‚Äî Cricket Australia (@CricketAus) November 19, 2023



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    World Cup final, Australia 241/4 after 43 overs: Glenn Maxwell comes out for the last ball of the over and slashes to run two runs for victory! AUSTRALIA ARE THE 2023 ICC MEN‚ÄôS ODI WORLD CUP CHAMPIONS! For a record sixth time, the men in green and gold have triumphed in India‚Äôs own backyard and Pat Cummins and co. have caused a billion hearts to break. Travis Head with his century, Marnus Labuschagne with his half-century, Mitchell Starc with his three wickets and the fielding display from Australia outclassed India in every aspect of the game. 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    #CWC23Final #INDvAUSAUSTRALIA ARE WORLD CHAMPIONS, AGAIN! üèÜüì∏ Disney+Hotstarhttps://t.co/N2ErlyQjQs pic.twitter.com/Ta4BeSydVI‚Äî The Field (@thefield_in) November 19, 2023



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    World Cup final, WICKET! Travis Head 137 ct Gill b Siraj: Short from Siraj and Head holes out to Gill in the deep. Applause all round as the Indian players also congratulate the centurion who has been the star for Australia in this final. AUS 239/4 in 42.5 overs (need 2 runs from 43 balls)
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    Quite pathetic of the crowd that's already left the stadium. This team played like a dream for a month and a half. They -- and world champions Australia -- deserve a proper ovation at the end of this incredible match. Not empty seats.‚Äî Mihir Vasavda (@mihirsv) November 19, 2023



    #CWC23Final #INDvAUSMarnus Labuschagne scores an important half-century in this Australian chase.AUS: 225/3 (40 overs)üì∏ Disney+Hotstarhttps://t.co/N2ErlyQjQs pic.twitter.com/TwgteVJ5is‚Äî The Field (@thefield_in) November 19, 2023



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    World Cup final, Australia 225/3 after 40 overs (Target 241): A sublime boundary and Marnus Labuschagne reaches a fighting half-century. Albeit in a supporting role to Head‚Äôs innings, Labuschagne has been crucial in this incredible partnership. 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    Marnus Labuschagne‚Äôs best innings in an Australian shirt!‚Äî Kevin Pietersenü¶è (@KP24) November 19, 2023



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    World Cup final, Australia 214/3 after 38 overs (Target 241): A monster six off Kuldeep and Head is batting calmly but with such finesse. Labuschagne on the other end continues to give him solid support.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    Travis Head becomes the 7th player to score a century in a World Cup Final:1975:    Clive Lloyd 1021979:    Viv Richards 138*1996:    Aravinda de Silva 107*2003:   Ricky Ponting 140*2007:    Adam Gilchrist 1492011:     Mahela Jayawardene 103*2023: Travis Head#CWC2023‚Äî The CricViz Analyst (@cricvizanalyst) November 19, 2023



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    World Cup final, Australia 195/3 after 36 overs (Target 241): Head and Labuschagne now on cruise control as the victory is just under 50 runs away. 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    #CWC23 #INDvAUS Just a reminder that Australia had decided to include Travis Head in the 15-member squad even as he was injured. A century on return, a POTM performance in the semis, and a century in the final. Hats off! ü´°‚Äî Samreen (@SamreenRazz) November 19, 2023



    #CWC23Final #INDvAUSTravis Head with a knock worthy of a final! üëèHe gets to a üíØin an innings that has shifted the balance in favour of the Australians.AUS: 185/3 (33.5)üì∏ Disney+Hotstarhttps://t.co/N2ErlyQjQs pic.twitter.com/cZhGla4LbO‚Äî The Field (@thefield_in) November 19, 2023



    Travis Head becomes only the second batter after Aravinda de Silva to hit a hundred in a World Cup final chase.#CWC23 #INDvsAUS‚Äî Lalith Kalidas (@lal__kal) November 19, 2023



    Travis Head: centuries against India in a World Test Championship final and a World Cup final, five months apart. Incredible achievement‚Äî Matt Roller (@mroller98) November 19, 2023



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    World Cup final, Australia 185/3 after 34 overs (Target 241): A quick single and TRAVIS HEAD GETS HIS CENTURY! After a brilliant half-century in the semi-final, the Australian, who missed the first few games of the tournament, is now on his way to become a huge match-winner for his country. 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    to think labuschagne wasn't even in the original squad and head missed the first few games of the campaign with injury...and here they are!predict sport at your own peril!#INDvsAUSfinal #INDvsAUS #ICCWorldCup2023‚Äî Gaurav Kalra (@gauravkalra75) November 19, 2023



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    World Cup final, Australia 170/3 after 31 overs (Target 241): A little frustration from Bumrah who whips the bails off with his towel at the end of his over before Jadeja completes his eighth over.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    World Cup final, Australia 167/3 after 30 overs (Target 241): Two quiet overs from Jadeja and Bumrah but Head and Labuschagne are untroubled. Australia need 74 from the last 20 runs.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    My goodness! The impact of Travis Head has been colossal!! Courage.This is why they backed him despite his broken hand.#CWC2023Final #INDvAUS‚Äî Mpumelelo Mbangwa (@mmbangwa) November 19, 2023



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    World Cup final, Australia 162/3 after 28 overs (Target 241): Travis Head is now rubbing salt in the Indian wounds. Misreads a slower delivery and while off balance, still manages to hit it for a four in the vacant deep midwicket region. Then plays a beautiful straight drive which evades both the chasing mid-on and mid-off fielders. Oh this is not going India‚Äôs way! Bumrah traps Labuschagne with a delightful yorker and India review. Pitching in line, impact in line but wickets is umpire‚Äôs call. Bumrah has his face in his hands. Head then piles on the misery by pulling Bumrah for a four off the last ball. 14 off that Bumrah over.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    World Cup final, Australia 148/3 after 27 overs (Target 241): The 100-run stand comes up for Head and Labuschagne. Australia cruising now.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    Three successive overs Aus find the boundary on the first ball then milk or defend the rest (bar that last 4). This is such smart batting by Head and Labuschagne. Surely there's another twist to come? #CWC23 #INDvAUS‚Äî Melinda Farrell (@melindafarrell) November 19, 2023



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    World Cup final, Australia 144/3 after 26 overs (Target 241): Oh lovely cover drive from Labuschagne. Pitched up from Shami and Labuschagne creams it through the covers. Head ends the over by pulling Shami to the square leg boundary. Australia need less than 100 to win now.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    Off the top of my head, Travis joining the likes of Mohinder Amarnath, Aravinda de Silva, Shane Warne with match-winning performances in the semifinal and final of a World Cup.‚Äî Vinayakk (@vinayakkm) November 19, 2023



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    World Cup final, Australia 135/3 after 25 overs (Target 241): Lady Luck firmly with Australia now. Turn and bounce from Jadeja and Head edges it past the vacant first slip for a four. Four singles follow as Jadeja concedes eight in that over.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    World Cup final, Australia 127/3 after 24 overs (Target 241): Rohit Sharma brings Shami back into the attack looking for a breakthrough and Head welcomes him back by whacking the ball straight over Shami‚Äôs head. Deathly silence in the stadium. Five runs off the over.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    World Cup final, Australia 122/3 after 23 overs (Target 241): Jadeja brought back into the attack. Five singles off him. Head and Labuschagne are doing really well keeping the scoreboard ticking, something India did not do in the middle overs.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    Players with 50+ scores opening the batting in both semi-final and final of a men's World Cup tournament:2023 - Travis Head1987 - David Boon1979 - Mike Brearley‚Äî Andy Zaltzman (@ZaltzCricket) November 19, 2023



    Some 80 people among the 11000+ at the Narendra Modi Stadium clapped their hands together as Travis Head raised his bat after reaching his 50. Must feel like a late-season #SheffieldShield game at the Adelaide Oval for Trav #CWC23 #IndvAus‚Äî Bharat Sundaresan (@beastieboy07) November 19, 2023



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    World Cup final, Australia 117/3 after 22 overs (Target 241): 50 up for Travis Head! Back to back 50s for the southpaw. Will it turn out to be a match-winning knock for Australia?
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    World Cup final, Australia 110/3 after 21 overs (Target 241): Siraj comes round the wicket and digs one in short. Head reads it a mile away and shifts to the on side to pull the ball to the deep midwicket fence. Six runs off that over.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    Be tempted with a slip to Marnus with Siraj bowling #INDvsAUS‚Äî Isa Guha (@isaguha) November 19, 2023



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    World Cup final, Australia 104/3 after 20 overs (Target 241): It looks like it has become easier to bat now. Kuldeep Yadav begins his fifth over. Four off it as the 100 comes up for Australia.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    World Cup final, Australia 99/3 after 19 overs (Target 241): Siraj continues as Head and Marnus Labuschagne bring up their 50-run stand.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    Less slower balls (apart from wristy ones from Bumrah) more Yorkers/short stuff now for the quicks. Rohit needs to get rid of some more spin overs too #INDvAUS‚Äî Isa Guha (@isaguha) November 19, 2023



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    World Cup final, Australia 93/3 after 17 overs (Target 241): Mohammed Siraj is into the attack. His fourth ball is short and Head obliges him by cutting it straight to the boundary. Six runs off Siraj‚Äôs first over.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    Most Powerplay Extras conceded by India in their last 200 ODIs:=1st: 15, v Aus, World Cup final, today=1st: 15, NZ, WC semi-final, the other day3rd: 14, v Aus, Bangalore, Jan 2020‚Äî Andy Zaltzman (@ZaltzCricket) November 19, 2023



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    World Cup final, Australia 87/3 after 16 overs (Target 241): Clubbed it! It‚Äôs in the slot from Kuldeep and Head slogs it over deep midwicket for a huge six! Feel India need to get Head out as soon as possible to hamstring the Australian chase. 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    World Cup final, Australia 74/3 after 14 overs (Target 241): A pair of tight overs from Kuldeep and Jadeja. Australia were very good in stopping the run flow after the power play. India have the quality to do it as well.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    World Cup final, Australia 68/3 after 12 overs (Target 241): Spin from both ends as Kuldeep Yadav is brought into the attack. Only three runs from Yadav‚Äôs first over.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    17 extras already bowled by India and after only 10 overs. Will that be costly? üßê #INDvsAUS #CWC2023Final‚Äî Lisa Sthalekar (@sthalekar93) November 19, 2023



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    World Cup final, Australia 65/3 after 11 overs (Target 241): Ravindra Jadeja is into the attack and India have two close shouts for LBW, one against each Australian batter. India don‚Äôt review.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    World Cup final, Australia 60/3 after 10 overs (Target 241): Back to back boundaries from Head to relieve the pressure. Guides a short ball past short third man and follows it up with a powerful on drive. Nine runs come off Shami‚Äôs fifth over as Australia post 60 in the power play for the loss of three wickets. India were 80/2 at the same stage.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    World Cup final, Australia 51/3 after nine overs (Target 241): No runs off an Australian bat in the over but the 50 is up as Rahul fails to collect a low ball which races to the boundary.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    Steve Smith is convinced every lbw ever given against him isn't out except for the one that isn't actually out‚Äî Ben Gardner (@Ben_Wisden) November 19, 2023



    Not the first time he has had a brain fade against us üòÖ‚Äî Kartik O üèè‚öΩüîó (@KOCricket528) November 19, 2023



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    World Cup final, Australia 47/3 after eight overs (Target 241): A maiden over from Mohammed Shami! India have their tails up. Ahmedabad has found its voice.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    India have the start they needed. Bumrah has been sensational and ridiculously skilful.‚Äî Harsha Bhogle (@bhogleharsha) November 19, 2023



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    World Cup final, WICKET! Steve Smith 4 lbw b Bumrah: Bumrah strikes again! Ahmedabad goes crazy! An off cutter from Bumrah and Smith tries to defend but misses it as the ball strikes his pad. Has a chat with Head but does not take the review. Oh he should have! The replays show that the ball struck him outside the line of off stump! Smith will be kicking himself in the dressing roon. AUS: 47/3 in 7 overs (Target 241)
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    The 15-run over from Bumrah was his most expensive in WC 2023 and the first time he has conceded 10+ runs in an over inside Powerplay 1. #INDvAUS‚Äî Deepu Narayanan (@deeputalks) November 19, 2023



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    World Cup final, Australia 42/1 after six overs (Target 241): A huge appeal from India as he ball raps Head on the pads. Everyone looks to Rahul who has been spot on with his reviews. He is not interested suggesting that the ball was swinging down the leg side. India rightly don‚Äôt review as there was an inside edge. Only one run from that Shami over.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    There has been significant chatter about how the Indian bowling has overshadowed it's powerful batting unit. More than ever, they need it to happen again tonight, and it's been a good start! #INDvsAUS‚Äî Shahid Judge (@shahidthejudge) November 19, 2023



    #CWC23Final #INDvAUSExtra bounce from Jasprit Bumrah and Mitchell Marsh edges it behind to KL Rahul looking for a cut.AUS: 41/2 (4.3)üì∏: Hotstarhttps://t.co/N2ErlyPM0U pic.twitter.com/EOQxAbEaML‚Äî The Field (@thefield_in) November 19, 2023



    Relentless bowling from @MdShami11 and @Jaspritbumrah93!!üî•üî• Despite the runs, they've taken important wickets early on. The game is wide open! üí™üèæ#CWC23Final #IndvAusFinal‚Äî Robin Aiyuda Uthappa (@robbieuthappa) November 19, 2023



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    World Cup final, WICKET! Mitchell Marsh 15 ct Rahul b Bumrah: Bumrah strikes and that is the most un-Bumrah like celebration. He is absolutely pumped. Marsh looked to cut a short ball but ends up under edging it behind. AUS: 41/2 in 4.3 overs (Target 241)
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    World Cup final, Australia 41/1 after four overs (Target 241): Pin drop silence in the stadium as Marsh smokes Shami into the stands at long off. Excellent running from Marsh and Head as they complete a risky double. Australia exactly 200 runs away from the target now.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    World Cup final, Australia 29/1 after three overs (Target 241): Two close play and misses from Marsh. Bumrah is making the ball move. A ball later, Head plays and misses. Bumrah can only smile wryly. Ends the over with another superb ball which Head nearly edges. Good comeback from Bumrah after the first over. Just one run off this one.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    World Cup final, Australia 28/1 after two overs (Target 241): The ball is swinging wildly after going past the stumps as Australia collect one bye and five wide runs. Mitch Marsh then gets off the mark with a booming aerial drive which races to the boundary. 13 runs and a wicket off that Shami over
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    2003 World Cup Final - Zaheer Khan conceded 15 runs in the first over 2023 World Cup Final - Jasprit Bumrah concedes 15 runs in the first over #INDvsAUSFinal #ICCCricketWorldCup23‚Äî Bharath Seervi (@SeerviBharath) November 19, 2023



    #CWC23final #INDvsAUS BRILLIANT START FROM SHAMI!! The Indian bowler gets David Warner to nick one and Virat Kohli pockets it safely! AUS: 16/1 in 1.1 overs, need 225 from 48.5 oversIND: 240 all out in 50 oversüì∏ Disney+ Hotstarhttps://t.co/N2ErlyQjQs pic.twitter.com/6kwH7f2KIG‚Äî The Field (@thefield_in) November 19, 2023



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    World Cup final, WICKET! David Warner 7 ct Kohli b Shami: Of course it‚Äôs that man! Warner once again goes for the drive but edges it and Kohli takes a sharp catch at first slip. Rohit Sharma roars. Ahmedabad roars! AUS: 16/1 in 1.1 over (Target 241)
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    World Cup final, Australia 15/0 after one over (Target 241): Bumrah getting the ball to swing from the get go and he should have gotten Warner first ball! Warner flashed at an outswinging delivery and the edge takes it towards the slips. Both Kohli and Gill expect the other to take it and Warner starts with a four. He follows it up with a cover drive which Jadeja chases and saves a single. Head plays a beautiful cover drive to get off the mark. Ends the over with another powerful cover drive! Australia hit Bumrah for 15 off the first over!
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    World Cup final, Australia 0/0 (Target 241): Right then! Time for the chase! Travis Head and David Warner begin Australia‚Äôs chase. Jasprit Bumrah has the new ball. Will he provide India the start they need?
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    After the blistering knock by Rohit Sharma, the Australians started to make their way back into the second innings. Virat Kohli (54 off 63) and KL Rahul (66 off 107) scored half-centuries, but all the other Indian batters were dismissed for less than 20 runs each ‚Äì six ended on single figures.India eventually were bowled out for 240, but it seems to be a fighting total on a pitch that seems to favour the bowlers.The Australians ‚Äì led by the skill of Mitchell Starc (3/55 in 10 overs) ‚Äì worked well with the ball. And their fielding effort was exceptional, all highlighted by Travis Head‚Äôs astounding catch to dismiss Sharma.In a tournament where India‚Äôs bowlers have overshadowed their powerful batting department, the likes of Jasprit Bumraj and Mohammed Shami will now have a challenge on their hands.Second innings coming up shortly. Stay tuned!
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    Boundaries hit by India batters in the final today: First 10 overs - 12 boundaries Last 40 overs - 4 boundaries Just just just 4 boundaries in 40 overs!!!!!! What a batting display we have seen in the much anticipated World Cup FINAL! #INDvsAUS #icccricketworldcup2023 pic.twitter.com/U6PFmcE3dt‚Äî Bharath Seervi (@SeerviBharath) November 19, 2023



    #CWC23Final #INDvAUSINDIA, ALL OUT!Kuldeep Yadav is run out of the final ball of the innings looking to sneak in a double. Australia have bowled out India in the final.IND: 240/10 (50)üì∏: Hotstarhttps://t.co/N2ErlyQjQs pic.twitter.com/3gejGaCtBn‚Äî The Field (@thefield_in) November 19, 2023



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    World Cup final, India 240 all out after 50 overs: A brilliant boundary from Siraj but Kuldeep is run out on the last ball trying to get that extra run. Not the total they wanted, but with the pitch slowing down more, the likes of Bumrah and Shami will definitely give a tough test to the Australian batters. 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    World Cup final, India 232/9 after 49 overs: All to do for Kuldeep and Siraj now as the final over approaches with Hazlewood to bowl.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    #CWC23Final #INDvAUSThere goes India's last hope with the bat as Suryakumar Yadav is bounced out by Josh Hazlewood.Can India bat out 50 overs?IND: 226/9 (47.3)üì∏: Hotstarhttps://t.co/N2ErlyQjQs pic.twitter.com/ilIKcL1fm6‚Äî The Field (@thefield_in) November 19, 2023



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    World Cup final, WICKET! Suryakumar Yadav 18 ct Inglis b Hazlewood: Taking the pace off the ball has worked for Hazlewood and Australia as SKY edges a slower ball into the hands of Inglis. IND: 226/9 in 47.3 overs
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    World Cup final, India 223/8 after 47 overs: An appeal for LBW by Cummins in the last ball that Kuldeep just manages to dig out for a dot.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    World Cup final, India 221/8 after 46 overs: Singles all the way through as Mitchell Starc finishes his overs with 3/55. 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    #CWC23Final #INDvAUSSuryakumar Yadav is running out of partners. India have lost Mohammed Shami and Jasprit Bumrah in quick sucession and are in danger of being bowled out.IND: 214/8 (44.5)üì∏: Hotstarhttps://t.co/N2ErlyQjQs pic.twitter.com/bynlkhLU2y‚Äî The Field (@thefield_in) November 19, 2023



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    World Cup final, WICKET! Jasprit Bumrah 1 lbw Zampac: Bumrah tries to defend but Zampa traps him in the crease and dismisses him LBW. A shake of the head from Bumrah and India are in trouble! IND 214/8 in 44.5 overs
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    World Cup final, WICKET! Mohammed Shami 6 ct Inglis b Starc: Shami tries to hit Starc over and gets a thick enough edge for Inglis to take comfortably again. IND 211/7 in 43.4 overs
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    India hit just two boundaries in overs 11-40 inclusive - the joint fewest boundaries in that phase of a men's WC innings, where ball-by-ball data available (over 750+ innings)‚Äî Andy Zaltzman (@ZaltzCricket) November 19, 2023



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    World Cup final, India 207/6 after 42 overs: Rahul‚Äôs attritional but crucial innings came to an end but Shami gets one to trickle down to fine leg for a much-needed boundary.

    World Cup final, India vs Australia: So no changes from either side.
